Posts.Content: Originally Posted by PDV BTW, I can't say enough good things about Dr. Kibel and his staff at Brigham and Women's/Dana Farber in Boston. Class acts! Hi brother to the south of me. Just got my first taste of what a high PSA level is. Mine is 6.1 from a blood test about 3 weeks ago. I just went for another BT yesterday. I go to Concord Hospital where I live in NH. They have an on-line site. I'm waiting to see the results from yesterday. I am going to a Urologist on the 25th. But you know us up here, we have to hike and climb those White Mountains, LOL. I went for a 5+ mile hike on Sunday, and then had the new BT yesterday. I hope that wasn't a mistake. I'm new to all of this and was told exercise can raise the PSA level....or something like that. Enough about me. You sound like things are working out for you. I so glad for you. You hang in there and so will I. If you have to stop one of those 2 things you mentioned drinking, stay with the beer and dump the coffee. Joey from Concord, NH
Posts.Signature: Age: 59 D.O.B. 3/29/56 Concord Hospital, NH Urologist: Robert Mitchell, MD 08/17/2015: PSA 0.48 ng/mL *08/14/2015: PSA, INCREASED. Posts.Title: Urge to pee waking me up

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi JJR, When we're talking about 0.1 or 0.2, we're not referring to regular check-up based PSA readings. These numbers deal with POST-SURGERY PSA readings, which should be zero without a prostate and if all the cancer was removed. So this would not be of any comparison to your 6.1. On the other hand, a 6.1 is above normal, so hopefully your new PSA test will be back in normal ranges. Just be sure that you have NOT had sex, done any bike riding, no strenuous exercise and no digital rectal exams over the past 2 days in advance of Monday's test. Please let us know what the results are. Thank you for the info. I'm so new to this. I went for a 5 mile hike yesterday and I'm going now for that new blood test. Now I'm wondering if I should wait until tomorrow to go for the new BT. I'm sorry I'm so freaked out about all of this when it looks like most of you have gone through so much worse. I'm just so alone with this and know nothing about what I should be doing or feeling. I have no one to talk to about all of this. All I know is my doctor said I might have PC and he's sending me to a Urologist. Ya know what....I'm waiting for tomorrow to go for the new BT. I'm so confused!

Posts.Title: Should I Delay PSA Test After Taking a Long Hike?

Posts.Content: Thank you Jim, Chuck and everyone else here. It's been about 3 weeks since I was told my PSA level was 6.1. I never even thought about prostate issues before. I thought I was so healthy because I live a clean life, and longevity is in my family. I'll be honest, I'm scared. But reading a lot of posts here and reading peoples results at the bottom of there signature, I now know if I do have prostate cancer, I can live. It will be a heck of a ride, but I will live. I thought for the past few weeks that my days were numbered and I was trying to grasp the idea of death. Sorry to sound so blunt, but I really was thinking that. I'm so glad I found this board. Thank you all again for listening to me and responding to me. I don't feel alone anymore.

From there I can ask questions and let you know what's happening here. Thank you all so much for being here for me.

Posts.Title: Should I Delay PSA Test After Taking a Long Hike?

Posts.Content: You all are saying that 0.1 or 2 is bad. Now I'm worried. Mine is 6.1. I am getting a new PSA test tomorrow. I'm hoping there was a false reading. I have not one symptom. I exercise, I'm not over weight, I don't drink or smoke, it doesn't run in my family....what else can I say? If I have prostate cancer, I'll be the first one in a long line of men in my family to have it.

These numbers deal with POST-SURGERY PSA readings, which should be zero without a prostate and if all the cancer was removed. So this would not be of any comparison to your 6.1. On the other hand, a 6.1 is above normal, so hopefully your new PSA test will be back in normal ranges. Just be sure that you have NOT had sex, done any bike riding, no strenuous exercise and no digital rectal exams over the past 2 days in advance of Monday's test. Now I'm wondering if I should wait until tomorrow to go for the new BT. I'm sorry I'm so freaked out about all of this when it looks like most of you have gone through so much worse. I'm just so alone with this and know nothing about what I should be doing or feeling. I have no one to talk to about all of this. Just be sure that you have NOT had sex, done any bike riding, no strenuous exercise and no digital rectal exams over the past 2 days in advance of Monday's test. Please let us know what the results are. Thank you for the info. I'm so new to this. I went for a 5 mile hike yesterday and I'm going now for that new blood test. Now I'm wondering if I should wait until tomorrow to go for the new BT. I'm sorry I'm so freaked out about all of this when it looks like most of you have gone through so much worse. I'm just so alone with this and know nothing about what I should be doing or feeling. I have no one to talk to about all of this. All I know is my doctor said I might have PC and he's sending me to a Urologist. Ya know what....I'm waiting for tomorrow to go for the new BT. I'm so confused!

Posts.Title: Should I Delay PSA Test After Taking a Long Hike?

Posts.Content: Sorry I'm using this thread...I didn't mean to. My wife talked me into going this morning for the BT. I'll let you know the results. I'll start a new thread called, "JJR Newbie". From there I can ask questions and let you know what's happening here. Thank you all so much for being here for me.
